Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Oral PDE-5 Inhibitors in Children with VSD and Pulmonary Hypertension

Participants.evidence: 51 children with VSD and PH were enrolled at a tertiary cardiac referral centre

Intervention.evidence: randomly assigned to receive either sildenafil or tadalafil (n=34) or placebo (n=17)

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the effect of oral phosphodiesterase type 5 (PDE-5) inhibitors on postoperative pulmonary hypertension (PH) and right ventricular (RV) function in children with ventricular septal defect (VSD).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the change in right ventricle systolic pressure (RVSP) and mean pulmonary artery pressure (mPAP) postoperatively and at follow-up.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding included outcome assessors, patients, and clinicians.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 51 children with VSD and PH were enrolled

Result_Outcome.evidence: There was no significant difference in RVSP improvement between the PDE-5 inhibitor group and the placebo group postoperatively (p=0.255) and at follow-up (p=0.259).

Harms.evidence: Two deaths occurred in the PDE-5 group, and one patient experienced a pulmonary hypertensive crisis.

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial registration: IRB approval number: 10/2022 PDEI 11-2.
